Title: Automation Service Engineer, Baltimore MD
Job_Description:
Job Description Summary
The Staff Embedded Software/ Electrical Engineer is a technical leadership position leading the embedded software development and electrical design/architecture for medical device product advancements. The individual would have responsibility for working cross-functionally to understand end-user needs and system requirements and mapping them to detailed embedded software and electrical design specifications and translating these into robust architecture and design elements.
The responsibilities can include, but are not limited to: embedded electronics and software architecture definition, board design and updates & design for critical features and functions, leading & enabling implementation of features as part of a multi-disciplinary R&D team (systems, electrical, mechanical and application software). Integrating and verifying implemented features through unit and functional testing.
Typically, the Staff Engineer will interface with other development teams for product integration and will interface both internally and externally to understand the clinical use cases, usability and system requirements.

Title: Automation Service Engineer, Baltimore MD
Job_Description:
Job Description Summary
Summary:
The Senior Manager, Firmware Engineering is a technical and people leadership position leading the embedded software/firmware development for medical device product advancements. The individual would have responsibility for leading firmware teams across different sites and working cross-functionally to deliver and support firmware/embedded products for the smart connected care platform.
The responsibilities can include but are not limited to: Own and manage product firmware development for flagship connected medical devices, managing firmware engineers across geographies and taking ownership for the design and development process, validation, planning, and communication with senior management, embedded electronics and software architecture definition, leading & enabling implementation of features as part of a multi-disciplinary R&D team (systems, electrical, mechanical and application software), integrating and verifying implemented features through unit and functional testing, developing characterization and evaluating programs for new products.

Title: Automation Service Engineer, Baltimore MD
Job_Description:
Job Description Summary
I. POSITION PURPOSE
Liberator Medical Supply, a subsidiary of BD, is seeking a Software Engineering Manager, Salesforce to lead and inspire teams focused on all aspects of our Salesforce platform to drive innovation, quality, and customer excellence. You will lead teams building solutions which enable our organization to make accurate customer-first decisions at every level, at the speed business demands.

This is a unique opportunity to lead our business and team in the healthcare space leveraging Marketing Cloud, Commerce Cloud, Experience Cloud, and Health Cloud. Our vision is to create world-class service capabilities making it easier for customers to manage their condition, improve their lives, and access and consume our products. We are implementing solutions that are customer-centric, integrated, efficient, flexible, scalable and user-friendly. You will work closely with various business, product, and technology teams to design and build innovate solutions.

The ideal candidate is an agile practitioner, fosters teamwork, and can build strong interpersonal relationships with the Operations teams, Technology team, Leadership, and Stakeholders with a focus on building the right functionality in the right order and helping overcome obstacles. This is a highly visible, business impacting position. The successful candidate must be highly analytical, detail-oriented, and naturally curious with the ability to improvise and develop creative solutions when common approaches fail. The candidate possesses a strong value of pragmatism over idealism in times of uncertainty with a perpetual curiosity and passion for honing your craft.

USA FL - Stuart Airport Road

Title: Project Manager, IT Corporate Services (Remote)
Job_Description:
Job Description Summary
The role of the Project Manager, Business Partner - Corporate Services is to serve as the person responsible for analyzing demand as well as the delivery of Technology & Global Services (TGS) solutions for Corporate Services. This individual will serve as a point person and will work with a team of business partners to conduct analysis, prepare appropriate solution direction, and deliver the work. Above all, this individual will be required to collaborate with internal and external experts to ensure that business priorities are shaped, prioritized, and delivered. This is a great opportunity for someone to facilitate bringing the appropriate technology, process, and workplace solutions together as they contribute to the Corporate Services strategies and directions.

This position reports directly to the Lead, Portfolio, Projects & Change for Business Partner, Corporate Services and will serve on the TGS Business Partner - Corporate Services Portfolio, Projects & Change team.
USA TX - San Antonio

Title: Project Manager, IT Corporate Services (Remote)
Job_Description:
Job Description Summary
The Senior Program Manager (PM) will be responsible for leading a cross-functional team in executing a new product development for a novel medical device in the Intravenous Access (IVA) platform Hazardous Drug Solution (HDS) combined platform, which is part of the Infusion Preparation & Delivery (IPD) business. This platform develops products that work on intravenous catheters, such as needle-free connectors, to allow clinicians to have safe access to the patient. The PM will define the program vision and be responsible for developing, organizing and motivating a diverse, global cross-functional team to drive successful program execution. It is expected that the PM have a working understanding of all functions, so they can understand the deliverables and hold team members accountable. In addition, they will partner with the commercial team to drive the go-to-market strategy and ensure successful commercial launch. The PM is responsible for driving decisions and influencing solutions to business and technical problems. The PM is expected to implement the strategic and technical direction for the project/program team and effectively communicate program status and challenges at various levels within the organization. This is a high visibility leadership role, with opportunity to present frequently across various levels up to and including the portfolio decision team (PDT) and segment or C-level leadership.
USA CA – Brea

Title: Project Manager, IT Corporate Services (Remote)
Job_Description:
Job Description Summary
BE PART OF SOMETHING BIGGER!

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 70,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most challenging global health issues.
Job Description
The PMO Director will lead a team of program managers to drive the successful execution of Platform R&D initiatives that develop new innovative products, expand the competitiveness of existing products, and manage the lifecycle needs of our existing product lines. They will lead successful execution of 25+ parallel projects through a team of Program/Project Managers for a $500M to $1B business.

Working with Business, Functional, and R&D Leaders, this role will ensure execution of product portfolios and program roadmaps to key milestones and transparent reporting of program status to the Platform, Business Group, and Business Unit level. Serving as an agile problem solver, master negotiator, motivational coach, GPDS process expert, prudent risk taker, and team champion, the PMO Director will drive continuous improvement in project execution to deliver best in industry performance. Developing an empowered, agile PM culture, the Director will build a team of high performance, exceptional communicator program management leaders.

In close partnership with Associate Dir, PMO Transformation, the PM will champion continuous improvement within the organization, and will have leadership responsibility for planning, coordinating, and managing CI projects and initiatives that have a PMO and broad organizational impact focusing on Continuous Improvement initiatives/projects around our Product Delivery Process.
The PM has the responsibility across the entire CI project lifecycle from concept and initiation, through execution and monitor/control to ensure sustainability of results. He/She will define the program architecture and drive successful project / program execution globally by effectively develop, organize and motivate a highly skilled cross-functional team. USA NJ - Franklin Lakes

Title: Project Manager, IT Corporate Services (Remote)
Job_Description:
Job Description Summary
The Exponential Technologies (XT) Project Manager is an essential part of BD's Corporate Computer-Aided Engineering (CAE) team and contributes to advancing the world of health for BD's innovative portfolio of products and solutions. The Project Manager will report to the Senior Director, Corporate CAE. The CAE XT team currently focuses on Virtual Reality (VR)/Augmented Reality (AR)/ Virtual Tours (VT) and associated software applications. In this role, the Project Manager will have the opportunity to drive the development and deployment of new digital experiences to demonstrate product solutions, educate healthcare professionals on proper product use, and engage with stakeholders—from potential and current associates to customers and patients.

The candidate must have proven skills as a project manager and the ability to coordinate new developments with internal and external stakeholders. The candidate must be driven, action oriented, skilled with managing multiple high-profile projects with a keen understanding of the objectives and deliverables. We are seeking a highly motivated team member who excels in collaborative environments, and thrives on challenges. This position is a great opportunity to leverage CAE XT technologies to maximize value within the company and externally with BD's end customers.

USA NC - Research Triangle Park

Title: Project Manager, IT Corporate Services (Remote)
Job_Description:
Job Description Summary
Software Engineering Project Management is responsible for managing the execution of programs and/or projects consisting of single or multiple projects. Works within the constraints of budget, schedule and scope while managing and communicating risk and ensuring adherence to established processes and methodologies.

Seeking a highly motivated, self-directed, and experienced person to lead Agile software development. The ideal candidate is a professional who is a program or project manager for a company that develops enterprise-class software applications, has led multiple teams of 10+ software engineers indirectly reporting to the candidate, with experience in managing geographically dispersed teams.

Strong management skills with a proven record of providing direction and leadership to others are essential. The candidate must be a highly effective communicator and problem-solver. The candidate must also possess demonstrated skills in leading and managing change; should possess the ability to pull together ideas and suggestions, shape them into a vision, and then implement this in the project plans.

The selected candidate will be expected to bring new ideas, creativity and perspectives to our organization. You will lead by example, with leadership focused on accountability, collaboration, and transparency. You will also nurture a sense of camaraderie, success and appreciation among your team, and identify opportunities to improve team performance and effectiveness.

Excellent communication and cooperation within the Product Development organization and with all departments/stakeholders within the business unit (and beyond) is essential for success.
USA CA - San Diego Bldg A&B

Title: Systems Engineer (Remote)
Job_Description:
Job Description Summary
Job Description
Be part of something bigger!
BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 65,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most challenging global health issues.
The BD Central Server & Software Deployment team provides technical system recommendations/requirements to BD’s customers and working with the customers to deploy these servers and software in preparation for the local project team. Systems Engineers are assigned to customer projects and accounts based on regional/national organizational structures. The Systems Engineers work with the project implementation team toward the common goal of an on-time, successful system implementation. Activities include technical sales support, server deployment, software deployment, system design and initial configuration tasks. In addition to customer-facing responsibilities, this team is also responsible for many backend business functions including equipment and software ordering, product development input/R&D collaboration, solution design standard processes, and quality system requirements. The Systems Engineer will work closely with R&D for IDN level build and architectural design, as well as product XDE/Limited Release participation. Organizational Readiness activities involve remote and on-site support of the Alpha/Beta/Charlie progression and multi-functional team participation.

BD is one of the largest global medical technology companies in the world and is advancing the world of health by improving medical discovery, diagnostics and the delivery of care. We have over 70,000 employees and a presence in virtually every country around the world to address some of the most exciting global health issues.
BD Medication Management Solutions (MMS) is a global leader in the development of connected management solutions – from medication ordering to patient treatment – aimed at improving quality of care and patient and customer satisfaction. The Vice President (VP) of Product Development - Dispensing Research and Development (R&D), provides functional leadership towards the creation, design, development and ultimate confirmation that medication dispensing solutions meet the needs of the customer. Working with the Worldwide VP for R&D, MMS, the incumbent will lead high-performance teams of 350+ software, systems, and hardware engineers across the globe, and have responsibility for fostering a culture of innovation, accountability and psychological safety, while regularly assessing and improving organizational capability (and capacity) to maintain a premier R&D organization.

Job Description
Building the med-tech industry of tomorrow – today at BD!
A career in tech should inspire you. It should let you see the impact you can make – across the globe. As we march toward a future filled with smart, connected devices and alternative care settings, we invite you to learn more about who we are and why for 125 years, we’ve been at the forefront of the industry.
As we transform further into the digital realm, continued innovation requires strong technical skills across our businesses. If you have a growth mindset, want to continually level up your tech skills, and are enthusiastic about the future of med-tech, then BD is the place for you.

BD in Research Triangle Park, NC is looking for a new "hands-on" Senior Engineer to join our rapid prototype team. The CAE (Computer-Aided Engineering) Senior Engineer will have the opportunity to contribute to the advancement of BD’s next-generation medical products and enhance the current product portfolio. In this position you will support R&D, New Product Development, and Operations/Manufacturing by implementing rapid tooling/molding technologies utilizing a wide range of injection molding equipment and additive & subtractive tools. In this highly visible role, you will lead delivery of an end-to-end integrated simulation environment of integrated BD diagnostic products. The simulated environment will be operationalized and applied to R&D product development & testing as well as hardware configuration and system performance analysis.

The BD Central Server & Software Deployment team provides technical system recommendations/requirements to BD’s customers and working with the customers to deploy these servers and software in preparation for the local project team. Systems Engineers are assigned to customer projects and accounts based on regional/national organizational structures. The Systems Engineers work with the project implementation team toward the common goal of an on-time, successful system implementation. Activities include technical sales support, server deployment, software deployment, system design and initial configuration tasks. In addition to customer-facing responsibilities, this team is also responsible for many backend business functions including equipment and software ordering, product development input/R&D collaboration, solution design standard processes, and quality system requirements. The Systems Engineer will work closely with R&D for IDN level build and architectural design, as well as product XDE/Limited Release participation. Organizational Readiness activities involve remote and on-site support of the Alpha/Beta/Charlie progression and multi-functional team participation.

BD is a leading global medical technology company that develops, manufactures and sells medical devices, instrument systems and reagents. The Company is dedicated to improving people's health throughout the world. BD is focused on improving drug delivery, enhancing the quality and speed of diagnosing infectious diseases and cancers, and advancing research, discovery and production of new drugs and vaccines. BD's capabilities are instrumental in combating many of the world's most pressing diseases. Founded in 1897 and headquartered in Franklin Lakes, New Jersey, BD employs approximately 28,000 people in approximately 50 countries throughout the world. Title: Operations Data Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Description Summary
Reporting to the Sr. Manager, Channel Insights & Analytics, this position within the US Commercial Operations Insights and Analytics team was designed to build metrics and insights to support BD’s channel protection strategy to eliminate unauthorized access of BD products within grey market channels by US based distributors to protect pricing, profitability, authenticity, and quality of said BD products. Eliminating grey market sourcing will in turn prevent access by US distributors to grey market product. Success of this position is dependent upon providing meaningful data and insights that promote the quick and decisive identification of unauthorized sources of grey market product. A good candidate is intellectually curious who can adapt quickly to shifting priorities, manage through ambiguity, and communicate effectively with stakeholders across the organization.

The Senior Analyst, Channel Protection will partner with the Channel Protection team. This team will ensure business unit and OUS region participation and buy-in to strategies, policies, and plan execution. Each team member will be accountable for successfully executing specific actions related to their respective business unit.
